variant.bodyText: Copyright C) 1987 by the Association for Computational Linguistics. The code and copyright notice appearing at the bottom of the first page of an article in this journal indicate the copyright owner's consent that a single copy of the article may be made for personal use. Any copier must pay for copying beyond that permitted by Sections 107 and 108 of the U.S. Copyright Law. The per-copy fee for each article appears after the dollar sign and is to be paid through the Copyright Clearance Center, Inc. This consent does not apply to other kinds of copying, such as copying for general distribution, for advertising and promo- tional purposes, for creating new collective works, or for resale. Such permission requests and other permission inquiries should be addressed to the Managing Editor at the address given above. An order form for BACK ISSUES of the journal and for CONFERENCE PROCEEDINGS is included at the end of this issue. The AJCL was not published during 1979. SUBSCRIPTIONS to Computational Linguistics are available only through membership in the ACL. Each subscription includes both hard- copy and microfiche versions of the journal. ANNUAL DUES are $25 for personal, $50 for institutional, and $15 for student memberships. A joint membership for couples that provides one subscription is available for $30. The dues payment includes bulk or surface mailing fees. A Membership Application is on the reverse of the Order Form at the back of this issue. Instructions for PAYMENTS for dues or publications are included on the forms appearing at the back of this issue. Remittances should be made payable to the Association for Computational Linguistics (or ACL). Those sent to the ACL Secretary-Treasurer should be payable in US dollars. Arrangements have been made for dues to be remitted to banks in Switzerland or Japan. Details are given on the membership application form or are available from the ACL Secretary-Treasurer, the ACL Euro- pean Chapter Secretary (addresses on back cover), or Professor Makato Nagao [Electrical Engineering, Kyoto University, Yoshida, Sakyo, Kyoto, Japan].
variant.sectionHeader: Send ADDRESS CHANGES to Computational Linguistics's Managing Editor.
